Package com.phunware.locationmessaging

SDK for the Location Messaging platform from Phunware.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Callback<T>
    Communicates responses from the LocationMessaging SDK.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    LocationMessaging
    Main entry for the Phunware LocationMessaging SDK.
    LocationMessaging.Builder
    Initializes the singleton LocationMessaging instance with the provided settings.

Package com.phunware.locationmessaging Description

SDK for the Location Messaging platform from Phunware.

The main entry point of the Location Messaging SDK is the LocationMessaging, which allows you to access the key components of the SDK:

  • LocationManager
  • MessageManager
  • AttributeManager

Initialization

The SDK is accessed through the static methods on the LocationMessaging object, but before they can be accessed the SDK must be initialized. Initialization is performed through the LocationMessaging.Builder object.

A standard workflow for initializing the Location Messaging service might look like: 


 public class MyApplication extends Application {
      @Override
     public void onCreate() {
         super.onCreate();

         // Create a LocationMessaging instance
         LocationMessaging lm = new LocationMessaging.Builder(this)
             .brand("foo")
             .identifier("1234-5678-90ab-cdef")
             .environment(Environment.PROD)
             .build();

         // Configure a PwCoreSession and install the LocationMessaging module.
         PwCoreSession.getInstance().registerKeys(this, "appId", "accessKey", "signatureKey",
                 "encryptionKey");
         PwCoreSession.getInstance().installModules(lm.asModule());
     }
 }
After the LocationMessaging object has been initialized, you no longer need to keep a reference to it, you can simply use it's static methods to access the managers within.
